alert.note: Alert for Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 8:02AM EST until December 20 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Androscoggin River At Gorham affecting Coos and Oxford Counties. Androscoggin River Near Auburn affecting Cumberland, Androscoggin and Sagadahoc Counties. Androscoggin River At Rumford affecting Franklin, Androscoggin and Oxford Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Androscoggin River at Gorham. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flooding begins at the parking lot of businesses along Main Street north of Church Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM EST Tuesday was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 6.5 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
